body:
Look at the difference in damage. Nobody is blowing up, a squishy immobile marksman like Varus isn't immediately dying because of someone felt like flashing on top of him, there's actually room for breathing.

Edit: Look at how there is no free damage, nobody is doing a billion damage because they proc'd electrocute or dark harvest. You either do damage or you don't.

Even Varus who is fed as fuck isn't 3 shotting people with AAs or melting the enemy tank in 2 seconds.

{{champion:56}}  {{item:3147}}  {{item:3095}} 

he can do quite a bit

if this is level 11, he has 89 base AD + 55 duskblade + 60 stormrazor + up to 20 from shards + (variable by runes) and then i'm not sure if he can cast his Q before auto attacking but if he can, that's 60 more AD

284+ total AD , 224 before Q


ult deals 275 + 120% bonus AD ;  if we factor in that he might not get to Q after, he deals 414 from his ult,  100 from duskblade , first auto attack then deals 1.4 * 224 = 313.6 + 20% AD from passive = 44.8 ,  Q then deals 245 + 75% bonus AD = 349.25 and then adds 60 AD to everything after , E deals at max 170 (don't know build order) if not, 80

it is then a variable for what occurs by what the user chose for their build and if the opponent gets away or not and if the nocturne has ignite or not

275 + 166(from AD) + 100 from duskblade + 358.4 from first auto attack + 349.25 Q + 170 E, we get 1248 physical damage with 21 lethality minimum, which at level 11 reduces their armor by 17.7 ,  170 magic damage max;  then variables

if nothing procs, lets take lucian as the example since he's the current meta

lucian at level 11 will have 54.3 armor - 17.7 = 36.6 , magic resist 34.4

100/136.6 = 73% damage taken from physical ;  74% magic damage taken

with these numbers, with no external influence at all, nocturne deals 911 physical 125 magic damage from lucian's 1325.7 hp

with runes and variables taken into account, these numbers can get much higher, within a time span of about 0.7 seconds

#ignite alone gives it enough to be a kill at 330 true damage

lucian can adjust this a bit by opting for armor shards, but the result is almost the same

100/146.6 = 68% taken  848 physical , 125 magic , incidentally, if the person's runes are terrible, this gives him enough to survive ignite, but the odds of making a non-offensive setup lately in runes is fairly low.  The odds of not getting a second auto attack is also low,  and nocturne can also apply jungle damage buffs to his auto attacks

#this is also taking into account the worst possible situation, so who knows.  I don't even know if it's possible to have those items in nocturne's build at 11, the tally being 5700 gold

Your 0.7 second window for that damage seems generous, honestly. It's probably more like 0.2.

As for the gold, he'd need to have a few kills and some lane tax to make it happen by level 11.

If level 11 happens at around 15 minutes, that's 1703.4 (20.4g every 10 seconds after 1:05) ambient gold. (Side note: TBH, I'm not exactly sure when ambient gold starts generating. I'm assuming first minion spawn here.)

Now, the following numbers aren't technically possible...but just for fun:

If you kill non-buff camps, starting at 1:45, on spawn, every 2:30  you can get 6 clears in by 15 minutes.
This is 6 x 458 or 2748g (more realistically it'll be 5 clears for 2290)

You can also get 4 buff clears, starting at 1:30, every 5 minutes, for 200g each...or 800g.

800 + 2748 + 1703.4 = 5251.4g at 15 minutes, roughly level 11.

Probably closer to 4500-4750, realistically.

let's add in the runes for fun too XD

* dark harves for 40 - 80 (by level) + 5 per proc + 25% AD   ///////////  or Hail of Blades for 75 - 125% attack speed (which can increases the amount of attacks in your combo by about 2, but would be between 1 and 2 depending upon circumstances or more if given time, so 89 - 178 physical

* sudden impact for 7 more lethality

* ghost poro for 3 - 12 AD (based on level)  or eyeball collection:  0.6 - 12 AD based on ward takedowns and champion takedowns +6 if maxed

-------------------------------------------------------

and then choices between :

Absolute focus for about 13 more AD  and either Scorch for 10 - 30 magic damage or gathering storm for increasing AD every 10 minutes starting at 4.8 at 10 minutes and 10 more for every 10 minutes

OR

coup de grace , which offers 7% increased damage to targets below 40% health

Conquerer is also an option, but seems less reliable

Conqueror's wind-up time probably makes it less viable than other options...just speculating here, I don't play Nocturne.

So, if you had Challenging Smite (120 true damage over 3s when you hit them, at level 11) and DH (63.53 + 5/stack and 0.25 bonus AD) you could reasonably add more than an extra 200 damage to your above calculations.

Damage in this game is beyond absurd. It's almost comical.

Idk man all I remember is leblanc silencing me and killing me in 2 secs with deathfire grasp and me not being able to do anything.

These types of champions existed, and could instakill when ahead, definitely. Especially against the support. That was kind of the entirety of season 3. Supports dying to mid lane assassins.

But they had to actually work to get to that point. If you were behind you were a minion. If you were ahead, you were a god. Today none of that shit matters. You can be 0/9 and still explode people with 1 item.

Idk man zed leblanc definitely could kill me pretty quick back then too and then there was kass who could silence an entire team .

Supports back then too were just walking auras that could place wards and jungle were basically 3 champs Lee jarv and vi 

Overall the game state has definitely improved to a point that every role feels impactful in the game. 

I rlly don't agree with the 0 9 statement if you are behind that bad you aren't killing any one outside of an adc who is terribly behind themself and caught out.

Zed and LB needed to hit their full combo, be ahead in items and levels, AND they still couldn't do it from full HP..maybe 50-75%+. None of this shit with a 1 item Zed pressing R, AA, Ignite, maybe an E, and you die like you'll find today. 

Kass' silence was on his Q, which is single target. IDK where you're getting that he could silence an entire team.

I definitely agree that supports were in a pretty bad spot...but that's kind of the nature of support in this genre as a whole.

In the vein of everyone being impactful, I can't really disagree. Whether the game has improved in other aspects is entirely debatable.

Lastly, the 0/9 statement may be a touch exaggerated, unless we're talking about an assassin. 0/9 Zed with a Duskblade? All he needs to do is get the jump on a squishy and they're dead.
